meanings.definition: Willing to accept or agree to something.
meanings.sent1: She was very acceptive of the new rules at school.
meanings.sent2: He is always so acceptive of other people's opinions.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed surprisingly acceptive of the new kitten in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was an acceptive vessel for all the love that came her way.
meanings.sent5: The garden soil was rich and acceptive of the new seeds planted within.

meanings.definition: Able to receive or accept something.
meanings.sent1: The box was acceptive of all the items that were put inside.
meanings.sent2: The student's mind was acceptive of new knowledge and ideas.
meanings.sent3: The sponge was so acceptive of water that it soaked it all up in seconds.
meanings.sent4: The earth's atmosphere is acceptive of sunlight, warming the planet.
meanings.sent5: The cup was acceptive of the hot tea, warming her hands as she sipped.
